title: How to Make Meat and Mayonnaise Stuffed Egg Whites

steps.headline: Cut the eggs in half lengthwise and remove the yolks.
steps.description: Rinse well and set them aside.

steps.headline: Add the potted meat and mayonnaise into a bowl, blend and set aside.
steps.description: Have a good sized serving platter ready or a Tupperware container to put the stuffed egg whites on or in.

steps.headline: Fill each of the egg whites clean to the top, but do not allow the potted meat to run over the sides.
Place each one of the egg whites on the platter or in the Tupperware that's set up for them.
Store the stuffed egg whites in the fridge and allow them to chill for at least 20-25 minutes.
Season.
steps.description: Any salt or pepper can be added before or after refrigeration.

text: Boil the eggs. Then peel. Cut the eggs in half lengthwise and remove the yolks. Rinse well and set them aside. Add the potted meat and mayonnaise into a bowl, blend and set aside. Have a good sized serving platter ready or a Tupperware container to put the stuffed egg whites on or in. Fill each of the egg whites clean to the top, but do not allow the potted meat to run over the sides.  Place each one of the egg whites on the platter or in the Tupperware that's set up for them.  Store the stuffed egg whites in the fridge and allow them to chill for at least 20-25 minutes.  Season. Any salt or pepper can be added before or after refrigeration.
